result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan Joseph Karolewicz

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan Joseph Karolewicz in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Ryan Joseph Karolewicz.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.
Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal appeared in person in Court on 9/16/2022 requesting an adjournment of the 9/26/2022 status conference due to a conflict. Court grants a reschedule of the status conference to 10/27/2022 at 2:00 p.m.
All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Ryan Joseph Karolewicz in court.  Prosecuting attorney Owen M Piotrowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 09-26-2022 at 01:30 PM, Branch 13.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant/Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($1,000.00 signature bond) LW
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
Case in court for pretrial conference and calendar call.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenthal is newly appointed counsel and does not have good contact information with defendant.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with DAI (10/2/70)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ryan Joseph Karolewicz in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Ryan Joseph Karolewicz in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ryan Joseph Karolewicz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case retabbed to NON - DV intake judge of the week due to nature of case.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
